ovdesc.p: IS.ASSET.REVIEW is the application to capture the survey and appraiser details of the asset being purchased.
The information like date visited, the result of the survey, appraiser fees are captured in this table.

desc.p: The Next visit date of the Review planned.
2. Date should be greater than TODAY.
Any comments provided by the appraiser during the survey is recorded in this field.
Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input.

During Commit, the system may generate a series of screen override messages waiting for User Approval. If the record is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown in this field.
The Progress status of the Appraisal whether the asset manufacture/ building construction is in Schedule, Late, etc.
1. The valid values are On Schedule, Late, Ahead of Schedule.
1. Valid values are Success and Failure.
The Visit Date of the appraiser. This is the date on which the Appraiser visits and records review status of the Asset.
The Appraiser or Surveyor who reviews the asset.
1. Valid record in the table IS.REVIEWER.
Name of the Appraiser. Defaulted as Name of the Customer (@ID being Customer Reference). It can be over-written to specify User-Defined names.
1. Defaulted as NAME.1 from the Customer table.
The Type of review the reviewer will perform.
2. The value to be defaulted from "TYPE" field of the IS.REVIEWER table.
Captures the FT references that are created to pay the appraiser. This is a system updated field during Appraiser FT Payment.
The amount that the appraiser has valuated on the asset.
The Valuation Fees to be paid to the Appraiser.
3. Bank contribution and Customer contribution should sum to the value in the field VALUATION.FEES
The date that the valuation is effective.
The asset for which the review is performed. The asset will be one of the purchase contract specified in the @ID.
1. The asset must be purchased in the Contract.
Bank's contribution for the Appraiser fees.
1. Bank contribution and Customer contribution should sum to the value in the field VALUATION.FEES
Commodity of the purchase contract that is being reviewed. The commodity should be purchased in the contract specified in the @ID.
1. The commodity must be purchased in the Contract.
Completion percentage of the asset (say Building Construction) being reviewed. It will be a user-defined value fed by the user based on the appraisal details.
Customer's contribution for the Appraiser fees.
1. Bank contribution and Customer contribution should sum to the value in the field VALUATION.FEES
Captures the Description of the Review.

The ID of the application IS.ASSET.REQUEST.ID is of the format <IS.CONTRACT>-<UNIQUE.NO>. The first part of the ID is the Purchase contract that is going to get reviewed. The Second part is the system generated time-specific unique number.
